metadata.title: Text Formatting Demo
metadata.description: A quiz demonstrating cross-platform text formatting capabilities
metadata.author: PyQuizHub Team

data.text:
Welcome to the **Text Formatting Demo**!

This quiz demonstrates how *different formatting styles* work across platforms.

In standard Markdown, `**bold**` creates **bold text**.

What character surrounds bold text?

Great! Now let's look at *italic* text.

In our standard format:
- `*italic*` creates *italic text*
- `_text_` is also sometimes used for italic

What about ~~strikethrough~~? What characters create it?

Excellent! Let's explore code formatting.

Inline code uses backticks: `print('Hello')`

Code blocks use triple backticks:
```python
def greet(name):
    return f'Hello, {name}!'
```

Which of these is correct for inline code?

Last question! Links in Markdown use square brackets and parentheses.

Example: [Click here](https://example.com) creates a clickable link.

What is the correct format for a link?

**Quiz Complete!**

Your Results:
- Score: **{variables.score}** out of 100
- Level: *{variables.formatting_level}*

~~You failed~~ Just kidding! Great job learning about text formatting!

This message demonstrates:
- **Bold text** using `**text**`
- *Italic text* using `*text*`
- ~~Strikethrough~~ using `~~text~~`
- `Inline code` using backticks

Thanks for testing the formatting system! Check out more at [PyQuizHub](https://github.com/pyquizhub).
